question: Which religion is primarily based on the teachings of Siddhartha Gautama?

Which religion does not center around a single founding prophet?
Which religion views liberation as freedom from the cycle of samsara?

The belief that actions in this life affect future lives is central to which religions?

Which religion rejects both extreme asceticism and extreme indulgence?

Which religion does not accept the concept of an eternal creator god?

Which religion emphasizes devotion (bhakti) as a path to spiritual liberation?
Which religion considers suffering to be eliminated by eliminating desire?

Which religion includes the concept of Sangha as part of its core structure?
